gurmukhi: isDwr BUp Dwm ko ieqo n sok ko Dro ]bulwie ib`p Cox ky ArMB j`g ko kro ]
transliteration: Sidhaar Bhoop Dhaam Ko It One Sok Ko Daro|| Bulaae Bipp Chhodh Ke Aranbh Jagg Kodaro||
translation: “O king ! Go to your home forsaking the anxiety and begin the Yajna by calling the Brahmins.”

gurmukhi: suxMq bYx rwv rwjDwnIAY isDwrIAM ]bulwiekY bisst rwjsUie ko suDwrIAM ]41]
transliteration: Sounant Bain Raav Raajdhaaneeai Sidhdareean|| Bulaaekai Basist Raajsooe Ko Sudhdareean||41||
translation: Hearing these words, the king came to his capital and calling the sage Vasishtha, he determined to perform the Rajsuya Yajna.41.

gurmukhi: Anyk dys dys ky nrys bolkY ley ]idjys bys bys ky iCqs Dwm Aw gey ]
transliteration: Anek Des Des Ke Dares Bol-kai Lae|| Dijes Bes Bes Ke Chhites Dhaam Aa Gad||
translation: He invited the kings of many countries and also the Brahmin of different garbs reached there.

gurmukhi: Anyk BwNq mwn kY idvwn bolkY ley ]su j`g rwjsUie ko ArMB qw idnw Bey ]42]
transliteration: Anek Bhaant Maan Kai Divaan Bol-kai Lae|| Su Jagg Raajsooe Ko Aranbh Taa Dinaa Bhae||42||
translation: The king honoured all in many ways and the Rajsuya Yajna began.42.

gurmukhi: su pwid ArG AwsnM Anyk DUp dIp kY ]pKwr pwie bHmxM pRd`Cxw ibsyK dY ]
transliteration: Su Paadh Argh Aasanan Anek Dhoop Dhoop Deep Kai|| Pakhaar Paae Brahmanan Pradachchhanaa Bisekh Dai||
translation: Washing the feet of Brahmins and giving them their seats and buring the incenses and earthen lampas, the king circumambulated the Brahmins in a special manner.

gurmukhi: kror kor d`Cnw idjyk eyk kau deI ]su j`g rwjsUie kI ArMB qw idnw BeI ]43]
transliteration: Daror Kor Dachchhanaa Dijek Ek Kau Daee|| Su Jagg Raajsooe Kiaranbh Taa Dinaa Bhaee||43||
translation: He gave millions of coins to each Brahmin as religious gift and in this way, the Rajsuya Yajna begin.43.

gurmukhi: ntys dys dys ky Anyk gIq gwvhI ]AnMq dwn mwn lY ibsyK soB pwvhI ]
transliteration: Nates Des Des Ke Anek Geet Gadv-hee|| Anant Daan Maan Lai Bisekh Sobh Paav-hee||
translation: The comedians and minstrels from various countries began to sing songs and obtaining various kinds of honours they were well-seated in a special manner.

gurmukhi: pRsMin log jy Bey su jwq kaun qy khy ]ibmwn Awsmwn ky pCwn mo n huAY rhy ]44]
transliteration: Prasann(i) Log Je Bhae Su Jaat Kaoun Te Kahe|| Bimaan Aasmaan Ke Pachhaad Mo Na Huai Rahe||44||
translation: The pleasure of the people is indescribable and there were so many air-vehicles in the sky that they could not be recognized.44.

gurmukhi: huqI ijqI Ap`Crw clI suvrg Cor kY ]ibsyK hwie Bwie kY ncMq AMg mor kY ]
transliteration: Houtijitiapachchhraa Chalisuvarg Chhodh Kai|| Bisekh Haae Bhaae Kai Nachannd An Mor Kai||
translation: The heavenly damsels, leaving the heaven, were turning their limbs in special postures and dancing.

gurmukhi: ibAMq BUp rIJhI AnMq dwn pwvhIN ]iblok A`Crwn ko Ap`Crw ljwvhIN ]45]
transliteration: Beant Bhoop Reejh-hianant Daan Paav-heen|| Bilok Achchhraan Ko Apachchhraa Lajaav-heen||45||
translation: Many kings, in their pleasure were giving charities and seeing their beautiful queens, the heavenly damsel were feeling shy.45.

gurmukhi: AnMq dwn mwn dY bulwie sUrmw ley ]durMq sYn sMg dY dso idsw pTY dey ]
transliteration: Anant Daan Maan Dai Bulaae Soormaa Lae|| Durant Sain San Dai Daso Disaa Padhhai Dae||
translation: Bestowing various types of gifts and honours, the king called many mighty heroes and sent them in all the ten directions alongwith he tough forces.

gurmukhi: nrys dys dys ky niRpys pwie pwrIAM ]mhys jIq kY sBY su CqRpqR FwrIAM ]46]
transliteration: Dares Des Des Ke Nripes Paae Pdareean|| Mahes Jeet Kai Sabhai Su Chhatrapatra Dhdareean||46||
translation: They conquered the kings of many countries and made them subservient to Dasrath and in this why, conquering the kings of the whole world, brought them before the Sovereign Dasrath.46.

gurmukhi: jIq jIq niRpM nrysur s`qR im`qR bulwie ]ibpR Awid ibisst qy lY kY sBY irKrwie ]
transliteration: Jeet Jeet Nripan Daresur Sattra Mittra Bulaae|| Bipra Aadh Bisist Te Lai Kai Sabhai Rikhraae||
translation: After conquering the kinds, the king Dasrath called together the enemies as well as friends, the sages like Vashisht and the Brahmins.
